00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: GEOREF
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides conversions from Geodetic coordinates (latitude
00009  *    and longitude in radians) to a GEOREF coordinate string.
00010  *
00011  * ERROR HANDLING
00012  *
00013  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00014  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using 
00015  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00016  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00017  *
00018  *          GEOREF_NO_ERROR          : No errors occurred in function
00019  *          GEOREF_LAT_ERROR         : Latitude outside of valid range 
00020  *                                      (-90 to 90 degrees)
00021  *          GEOREF_LON_ERROR         : Longitude outside of valid range
00022  *                                      (-180 to 360 degrees)
00023  *          GEOREF_STR_ERROR         : A GEOREF string error: string too long,
00024  *                                      string too short, or string length
00025  *                                      not even.
00026  *          GEOREF_STR_LAT_ERROR     : The latitude part of the GEOREF string
00027  *                                     (second or fourth character) is invalid.
00028  *          GEOREF_STR_LON_ERROR     : The longitude part of the GEOREF string
00029  *                                     (first or third character) is invalid.
00030  *          GEOREF_STR_LAT_MIN_ERROR : The latitude minute part of the GEOREF
00031  *                                      string is greater than 60.
00032  *          GEOREF_STR_LON_MIN_ERROR : The longitude minute part of the GEOREF
00033  *                                      string is greater than 60.
00034  *          GEOREF_PRECISION_ERROR   : The precision must be between 0 and 5 
00035  *                                      inclusive.
00036  *
00037  *
00038  * REUSE NOTES
00039  *
00040  *    GEOREF is intended for reuse by any application that performs a 
00041  *    conversion between Geodetic and GEOREF coordinates.
00042  *    
00043  * REFERENCES
00044  *
00045  *    Further information on GEOREF can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00046  *
00047  *    GEOREF originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00048  *                              Geospatial Information Division
00049  *                              7701 Telegraph Road
00050  *                              Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00051  *
00052  * LICENSES
00053  *
00054  *    None apply to this component.
00055  *
00056  * RESTRICTIONS
00057  *
00058  *    GEOREF has no restrictions.
00059  *
00060  * ENVIRONMENT
00061  *
00062  *    GEOREF was tested and certified in the following environments:
00063  *
00064  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC version 2.8.1
00065  *    2. Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ version 6
00066  *
00067  * MODIFICATIONS
00068  *
00069  *    Date              Description
00070  *    ----              -----------
00071  *    02-20-97          Original Code
00072  *    03-02-07          Original C++ Code
00073  */
00074

00079  */

00098  *  string.h   - Standard C string handling library

00102  *  GeodeticCoordinates.h   - defines geodetic coordinates

00105  */

00112 /*                               DEFINES 
00113  *
00114  */
00115 
00116 const int TRUE = 1;
00117 const int FALSE = 0;
00118 const double LATITUDE_LOW = -90.0;           /* Minimum latitude                      */
00119 const double LATITUDE_HIGH = 90.0;           /* Maximum latitude                      */
00120 const double LONGITUDE_LOW = -180.0;         /* Minimum longitude                     */
00121 const double LONGITUDE_HIGH = 360.0;         /* Maximum longitude                     */
00122 const double MIN_PER_DEG = 60.0;             /* Number of minutes per degree          */
00123 const int GEOREF_MINIMUM = 4;                /* Minimum number of chars for GEOREF    */
00124 const int GEOREF_MAXIMUM = 14;               /* Maximum number of chars for GEOREF    */
00125 const int GEOREF_LETTERS = 4;                /* Number of letters in GEOREF string    */
00126 const int MAX_PRECISION = 5;                 /* Maximum precision of minutes part     */
00127 const int LETTER_I = 8;                      /* Index for letter I                    */
00128 const int LETTER_M = 12;                     /* Index for letter M                    */
00129 const int LETTER_O = 14;                     /* Index for letter O                    */
00130 const int LETTER_Q = 16;                     /* Index for letter Q                    */
00131 const int LETTER_Z = 25;                     /* Index for letter Z                    */
00132 const int LETTER_A_OFFSET = 65;              /* Letter A offset in character set      */
00133 const int ZERO_OFFSET = 48;                  /* Number zero offset in character set   */
00134 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;     /* PI                                    */
00135 const double DEGREE_TO_RADIAN = (PI / 180.0);
00136 const double RADIAN_TO_DEGREE = (180.0 / PI);
00137 const double QUAD = 15.0;                    /* Degrees per grid square               */
00138 const double ROUND_ERROR = 0.0000005;        /* Rounding factor                       */

00141 /************************************************************************/
00142 /*                              LOCAL FUNCTIONS     
00143  *
00144  */
00145 
00146 void extractDegrees( char *GEOREFString, double *longitude, double *latitude )
00147 { 
00148 /*    
00149  *  This function extracts the latitude and longitude degree parts of the 
00150  *  GEOREF string.  The latitude and longitude degree parts are the first four
00151  *  characters.
00152  *
00153  *    GEOREFString  : GEOREF string             (input)
00154  *    longitude     : Longitude in degrees      (output)
00155  *    latitude      : Latitude in degrees       (output)
00156  */
00157   long i;                             /* counter in for loops            */
00158   long temp_char;                     /* temporary character             */
00159   long letter_number[GEOREF_LETTERS]; /* number corresponding to letter  */
00160 
00161   for (i=0;i<GEOREF_LETTERS;i++)
00162   {
00163     temp_char = toupper(GEOREFString[i]);
00164     temp_char = temp_char - LETTER_A_OFFSET;
00165     if ((!isalpha(GEOREFString[i]))
00166         || (temp_char == LETTER_I)
00167         || (temp_char == LETTER_O))
00168     {
00169       if ((i == 0) || (i == 2))
00170         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::longitude );
00171       else
00172         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::latitude );
00173     }
00174     letter_number[i] = temp_char;
00175   }
00176   for (i=0;i<4;i++)
00177   {
00178     if (letter_number[i] > LETTER_O)
00179       letter_number[i] -= 2;
00180     else if (letter_number[i] > LETTER_I)
00181       letter_number[i] -= 1;
00182   }
00183   if ((letter_number[0] > 23) || (letter_number[2] > 14))
00184     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::georefString );
00185   if ((letter_number[1] > 11) || (letter_number[3] > 14))
00186     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::georefString );
00187 
00188   *latitude = (double)(letter_number[1]) * QUAD + (double)(letter_number[3]);
00189   *longitude = (double)(letter_number[0]) * QUAD + (double)(letter_number[2]);
00190 } 
00191 
00192 
00193 void extractMinutes( char *GEOREFString, long start, long length, long errorType, double *minutes )
00194 { 
00195 /*    
00196  *  This function extracts the minutes from the GEOREF string.  The minutes
00197  *  part begins at position start and has length length.  The ERROR_TYPE is
00198  *  to allow this function to work with both latitude and longitude minutes.
00199  *
00200  *    GEOREFString : GEOREF string                                        (input)
00201  *    start        : Start position in the GEOREF string                  (input)
00202  *    length       : length of minutes in the GEOREF string               (input)
00203  *    errorType    : has a value of either GEOREF_STR_LAT_MIN_ERROR  (input)
00204  *                    or GEOREF_STR_LON_MIN_ERROR
00205  *    minutes      : minute part                                          (output)
00206  */
00207   long i;                    /* counter in for loop  */
00208   char temp_str[(GEOREF_MAXIMUM-GEOREF_LETTERS)/2 + 1];
00209 
00210   for (i=0;i<length;i++)
00211   {
00212     if (isdigit(GEOREFString[start+i]))
00213       temp_str[i] = GEOREFString[start+i];
00214     else
00215     {
00216       if( errorType == GEOREF_STR_LAT_MIN_ERROR )
00217         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::latitude_min );
00218       else 
00219         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::longitude_min );
00220     }
00221   }
00222   temp_str[length] = 0;
00223   *minutes = (double)atof(temp_str);  /* need atof, atoi can't handle 59999 */
00224   while (length > 2)
00225   {
00226     *minutes = *minutes / 10;
00227     length = length - 1;
00228   }
00229   if (*minutes > (double)MIN_PER_DEG)
00230     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::georefString );
00231 } 
00232 
00233 
00234 long roundGEOREF( double value )
00235 { 
00236 /* Round value to nearest integer, using standard engineering rule */
00237 
00238   double ivalue;
00239   long ival;
00240   double fraction = modf (value, &ivalue);
00241 
00242   ival = (long)(ivalue);
00243   if ((fraction > 0.5) || ((fraction == 0.5) && (ival%2 == 1)))
00244     ival++;
00245 
00246   return ival;
00247 } 
00248 
00249 
00250 void convertMinutesToString( double minutes, long precision, char *str )
00251 { 
00252 /*    
00253  *  This function converts minutes to a string of length precision.
00254  *
00255  *    minutes       : Minutes to be converted                  (input)
00256  *    precision     : Length of resulting string               (input)
00257  *    str           : String to hold converted minutes         (output)
00258  */
00259 
00260   double divisor;
00261   long min;
00262   divisor = pow (10.0, (5.0 - precision));
00263   if (minutes == 60.0)
00264     minutes = 59.999;
00265   minutes = minutes * 1000;
00266   min = roundGEOREF (minutes/divisor);
00267   sprintf (str, "%*.*ld", precision, precision, min);
00268   if (precision == 1)
00269     strcat (str, "0");
00270 }

00296 GEOREF& GEOREF::operator=( const GEOREF &g )
00297 {
00298   if( this != &g )
00299   {
00300     semiMajorAxis = g.semiMajorAxis;
00301     flattening = g.flattening;
00302   }
00303 
00304   return *this;
00305 }

00307 
00308 MSP::CCS::GEOREFCoordinates* GEOREF::convertFromGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates, long precision )
00309 {
00310 /*   
00311  *  The function convertFromGeodetic converts Geodetic (latitude and longitude in radians)
00312  *  coordinates to a GEOREF coordinate string.  Precision specifies the
00313  *  number of digits in the GEOREF string for latitude and longitude:
00314  *                                  0 for nearest degree
00315  *                                  1 for nearest ten minutes
00316  *                                  2 for nearest minute
00317  *                                  3 for nearest tenth of a minute
00318  *                                  4 for nearest hundredth of a minute
00319  *                                  5 for nearest thousandth of a minute
00320  *
00321  *    longitude    : Longitude in radians.                  (input)
00322  *    latitude     : Latitude in radians.                   (input)
00323  *    precision    : Precision specified by the user.       (input)
00324  *    GEOREFString : GEOREF coordinate string.              (output)
00325  *
00326  */
00327 
00328   double long_min;                        /* GEOREF longitude minute part   */
00329   double lat_min;                         /* GEOREF latitude minute part    */
00330   double origin_long;                     /* Origin longitude (-180 degrees)*/
00331   double origin_lat;                      /* Origin latitude (-90 degrees)  */
00332   long letter_number[GEOREF_LETTERS + 1]; /* GEOREF letters                 */
00333   char long_min_str[MAX_PRECISION + 1];   /* Longitude minute string        */
00334   char lat_min_str[MAX_PRECISION + 1];    /* Latitude minute string         */
00335   long i;                                 /* counter in for loop            */
00336   char GEOREFString[21];
00337 
00338   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude() * RADIAN_TO_DEGREE;
00339   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude() * RADIAN_TO_DEGREE;
00340 
00341   if ((latitude < (double)LATITUDE_LOW) 
00342       || (latitude > (double)LATITUDE_HIGH))
00343     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::latitude );
00344   if ((longitude < (double)LONGITUDE_LOW) 
00345       || (longitude > (double)LONGITUDE_HIGH))
00346     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::longitude );
00347   if ((precision < 0) || (precision > MAX_PRECISION))
00348     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::precision );
00349 
00350   if (longitude > 180)
00351       longitude -= 360;
00352 
00353   origin_long = (double)LONGITUDE_LOW;
00354   origin_lat = (double)LATITUDE_LOW;
00355   letter_number[0] = (long)((longitude-origin_long) / QUAD + ROUND_ERROR);
00356   longitude = longitude - ((double)letter_number[0] * QUAD + origin_long);
00357   letter_number[2] = (long)(longitude + ROUND_ERROR);
00358   long_min = (longitude - (double)letter_number[2]) * (double)MIN_PER_DEG;
00359   letter_number[1] = (long)((latitude - origin_lat) / QUAD + ROUND_ERROR);
00360   latitude = latitude - ((double)letter_number[1] * QUAD + origin_lat);
00361   letter_number[3] = (long)(latitude + ROUND_ERROR);
00362   lat_min = (latitude - (double)letter_number[3]) * (double)MIN_PER_DEG;
00363   for (i = 0;i < 4; i++)
00364   {
00365     if (letter_number[i] >= LETTER_I)
00366       letter_number[i] += 1;
00367     if (letter_number[i] >= LETTER_O)
00368       letter_number[i] += 1;
00369   }
00370 
00371   if (letter_number[0] == 26)
00372   { /* longitude of 180 degrees */
00373     letter_number[0] = LETTER_Z;
00374     letter_number[2] = LETTER_Q;
00375     long_min = 59.999;
00376   }
00377   if (letter_number[1] == 13)
00378   { /* latitude of 90 degrees */
00379     letter_number[1] = LETTER_M;
00380     letter_number[3] = LETTER_Q;
00381     lat_min = 59.999;
00382   }
00383 
00384   for (i=0;i<4;i++)
00385     GEOREFString[i] = (char)(letter_number[i] + LETTER_A_OFFSET);
00386   GEOREFString[4] = 0;
00387   convertMinutesToString(long_min,precision,long_min_str);
00388   convertMinutesToString(lat_min,precision,lat_min_str);
00389   strcat(GEOREFString,long_min_str);
00390   strcat(GEOREFString,lat_min_str);
00391 
00392   return new GEOREFCoordinates( CoordinateType::georef, GEOREFString );
00393 }
00394 
00395 
00396 MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* GEOREF::convertToGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GEOREFCoordinates* georefCoordinates )
00397 {
00398 /*
00399  *  The function convertToGeodetic converts a GEOREF coordinate string to Geodetic (latitude
00400  *  and longitude in radians) coordinates.
00401  *
00402  *    GEOREFString : GEOREF coordinate string.     (input)
00403  *    longitude    : Longitude in radians.         (output)
00404  *    latitude     : Latitude in radians.          (output)
00405  *
00406  */
00407 
00408   long start;                /* Position in the GEOREF string                */
00409   long minutes_length;       /* length of minutes in the GEOREF string       */
00410   long georef_length;        /* length of GEOREF string                      */
00411   double origin_long;        /* Origin longitude                             */
00412   double origin_lat;         /* Origin latitude                              */
00413   double long_minutes;       /* Longitude minute part of GEOREF              */
00414   double lat_minutes;        /* Latitude minute part of GEOREF               */
00415   double longitude, latitude;
00416 
00417   origin_long = (double)LONGITUDE_LOW;
00418   origin_lat = (double)LATITUDE_LOW;
00419 
00420   char* GEOREFString = georefCoordinates->GEOREFString();
00421 
00422   georef_length = strlen(GEOREFString);
00423   if ((georef_length < GEOREF_MINIMUM) || (georef_length > GEOREF_MAXIMUM) 
00424       || ((georef_length % 2) != 0))
00425     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::georefString );
00426 
00427   extractDegrees( GEOREFString, &longitude, &latitude );
00428   start = GEOREF_LETTERS;
00429   minutes_length = (georef_length - start) / 2;
00430 
00431   extractMinutes(GEOREFString, start, minutes_length, 
00432                                 GEOREF_STR_LON_MIN_ERROR, &long_minutes);
00433 
00434   extractMinutes(GEOREFString, (start+minutes_length),
00435                                 minutes_length, GEOREF_STR_LAT_MIN_ERROR, &lat_minutes);
00436 
00437   latitude = latitude + origin_lat + lat_minutes / (double)MIN_PER_DEG;
00438   longitude = longitude + origin_long + long_minutes / (double)MIN_PER_DEG;
00439   latitude = latitude * DEGREE_TO_RADIAN;
00440   longitude = longitude * DEGREE_TO_RADIAN;
00441 
00442   return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, longitude, latitude );
00443 }
